The Great New Zealand Road Trip: A top NZ movie made this tiny village famous – 14 years on, it still draws visitors https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/the-great-new-zealand-road-trip-a-top-nz-movie-made-this-tiny-village-known-14-years-on-它仍然吸引游客/MAUA53YFTJDO5OT4VLT53QF25E/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/the-great-new-zealand-road-trip-a-top-nz-movie-made-this-tiny-village-known-14-years-on-它仍然吸引游客/MAUA53YFTJDO5OT4VLT53QF25E/ Shayne CurrieTaika Waititi's Boy lifts Waihau Bay, attracting visitors to Aunty Gracey's shop. Sun, 24 Nov 2024 09:22:03 +0000 Waihau Bay formed the backdrop to one of New Zealand's most beloved films, Boy.
Hundreds of volunteers refloat pilot whales after mass stranding on Ruakākā Beach in Northland https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/mass-pilot-whale-stranding-on-ruakaka-beach-northland/3SY6ID6BZNGRDBPNBJ5QZXSDRM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/mass-pilot-whale-stranding-on-ruakaka-beach-northland/3SY6ID6BZNGRDBPNBJ5QZXSDRM/Three of the whales succumbed on the shore. Sun, 24 Nov 2024 08:21:06 +0000 Hundreds of volunteers formed a “human wall” and used banging noises to refloat about 40 pilot whales after a mass stranding on Ruakākā Beach in Northland.
Kaikohe man sentenced to four years, seven months for brutal family violence https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/kaikohe-man-sentenced-to-four-years-seven-months-for-brutal-family-violence/ZGDVV5DPRVCBZD3XOLF3N4MWYY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/kaikohe-man-sentenced-to-four-years-seven-months-for-brutal-family-violence/ZGDVV5DPRVCBZD3XOLF3N4MWYY/ Shannon PitmanChild's bruise at school leads to Kaikohe man's arrest for serious family violence. Sun, 24 Nov 2024 07:53:46 +0000 The mother never retaliated as she did not want her children to see further violence. Stock Photo / 123 RF

Police continue search for missing Ōtaki Falls man David McHaffie and black labrador dog https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-continue-search-for-missing-otaki-falls-man-and-black-labrador/R5ZLGTHHUJD2TCA3MLGDT6VW6Q/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-continue-search-for-missing-otaki-falls-man-and-black-labrador/R5ZLGTHHUJD2TCA3MLGDT6VW6Q/The man was last seen at 7am on Kaitawa Rd. Sun, 24 Nov 2024 04:38:35 +0000 Police continue to search for David McHaffie and his black labrador dog, reported missing from Kaitawa Rd, Ōtaki Forks.

Police name victim of fatal Weymouth crash, five dead on roads in two days https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-name-victim-of-fatal-weymouth-auckland-crash- Five-dead-on-roads-in-two-days/NXTOBOGAQJFPTGQQFI7G3O26RY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-name-victim-of-fatal-weymouth-auckland-crash- Five-dead-on-roads-in-two-days/NXTOBOGAQJFPTGQQFI7G3O26RY/ The 29-year-old died in a single-car crash on Friday. Sun, 24 Nov 2024 02:49:57 +0000 Police have named the victim of a crash in Weymouth on Friday, during a deadly weekend on New Zealand roads. Photo / NZME.
Youth suicide inquest: Kaupapa Māori response filling gap in Northland suicide intervention https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/youth-suicide-inquest-kaupapa-maori-response-filling-gap-in-northland-suicide-intervention/H2X3FURLE5FCDOLE2REOYXW23U/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/youth-suicide-inquest-kaupapa-maori-response-filling-gap-in-northland-suicide-intervention/H2X3FURLE5FCDOLE2REOYXW23U/ Shannon PitmanTe Whatu Ora team supports whānau post-suicide, focusing on trust and community needs. Sun, 24 Nov 2024 02:00:00 +0000 The suspected suicides of Northland teenagers Ataria Heta, Summer Mills-Metcalf, Hamuera Ellis-Erihe and James Murray are under inquiry in a coroner's court in Whangārei.
Abuse in care: Survivors know how redress should work. Will the Government finally listen? - Stephen Winter https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/abuse-in-care-survivors-know-how-redress-should-work-will-the-government-finally-listen-stephen-winter/AP5GKYJABVADXHSIMX2FZS3SAM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/abuse-in-care-survivors-know-how-redress-should-work-will-the-government-finally-listen-stephen-winter/AP5GKYJABVADXHSIMX2FZS3SAM/ Stephen WinterOPINION: Survivors of abuse in care are owed substantial redress for their injuries.
